paymentMethod.description: Payment method used for the subscription.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore structure is designed to support user authentication and subscription management for StreamShare. It prioritizes Authorization Independence, DBAC (Database-Based Access Control), and QAPs (Rules Are Not Filters) to ensure security and scalability. User data is stored in `/users/{userId}`. User Subscriptions, representing the association between users and subscriptions, are stored in a subcollection `/users/{userId}/userSubscriptions/{userSubscriptionId}` for clear ownership and easy querying. This structure leverages path-based ownership for private user data and simplifies security rules. The structure inherently supports QAPs since `list` operations on `/users/{userId}/userSubscriptions` are naturally scoped to the user. There is no denormalization needed in this case, the structure provides authorization independence, as security rules can be based solely on `request.auth.uid` matching the `userId` path parameter.
